text:
Inés Etxegibel Alberdi (born 7 January 1974) is a Spanish rugby player and coach. She played for the Spanish Women's National Team. She played the most games for the Spanish National Team, along with Aroa González and Rocío García.
Inés Etxegibel was a student at the ikastola Kurutziaga, and continued her studies at the Durango Institute. He studied at the INEF at the University of Barcelona.
From the 1989 to 1996, she played on the Durango rugby team (DRT). From 1996 to 2002 she played for the L'Hospitalet Rugby Club. She played at the 1998 Women's Rugby World Cup, 2002 Women's Rugby World Cup. From 2003 to 2007, in addition to being a player, she was a coach at INEF Barcelona. In 2005, they won the Queen's Cup.
In 2009 she debuted as a Spanish coach in a match against Germany. In May 2011, she resigned as coach, in protest. In 2012 she returned as coach.
